intro: Grammica cuspidata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed grammica, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its intricate and often showy floral structures. The plant typically features slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, with flowers that are usually greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts of rare plants.
